We settled in at the bar and ordered up a couple pints; I had the Drifter, E had a Snakebite.  Then I had another, and E had a Chavelas. After chatting up the super-friendly bartender, we'd asked if she had a specialty; turns out her Bloody Mary is supposedly award-winning... we had to!  Sure enough, one of the better Bloody Marys I've ever had! 

*Scene: We sat and shared another drink while whoever picked out the jukebox tunes went on a Jackson-family spree (Jackson 5, '79 Michael, 90's Janet).

Four pints and two drinks later, we spent around $30, generous tip included... cheap drinks!  Friendly service! I likes!
___________________________________________
*Scene: E and I step out of the dark divey bar into the still bright-as-day early City evening, walk a few yards in the wrong direction and laugh, "Ha! Faded!".
author: Mikey U.

description: Got here within 15 minutes of the ball dropping on NYE! It was pretty empty considering how early the night was, but since it was the first bar we saw after getting of the bart my group and I decided to stay. The crowd was friendly and all seemed to know each other a lot which was pretty awesome.. the shots were HUGE. Had a good time before we moved onto our next spot!
author: Siobhan F.

description:
People complain about this place being dirty, chaotic, inconsistent and f*cked up, but, really, those are all the very characteristics that have kept me coming back here again and again.

Surely, there's a time and place for the Mandarin Oriental after work, and then there's a time for Sutter Gutter.  

The FiDi after work scene tends to be tidy, overpriced and predictable.  Sutter Station is an oasis not only because the bouncers are all good guys, (one of whom used to work in an auto repair shop down the street from where I first lived when I was young and poor and new to SF, and that he remembers me and smiles every time I'm here), but because this place and its crowd on any given night is completely unpredictable.  Sutter can range from homey and fun to somewhat frightening, and I'll be the first to admit that like to be surprised.

I've been here before on a weeknight evening and have watched as the crowd changes from after-work 9 to 5-ers to local construction workers just getting off a job site, to late-night randoms.  I've seen how the dudes playing dice at 11pm on a Tuesday had the female owner's back when a cracked out homeless guy came in, threatening her.  That's community, one cheap, stiff drink at a time.

I've seen fights break out here, and bad behavior, but for all of it, I've also seen a sort've overriding respectful tolerance.  The owner is a tough old bird, who is way cool and will treat you well as long as you behave and  tip her well.  They also have 3 different types of Fernet Branca on shelf.  Sutter Station deserves credit where it's due.
author: Sasha S.

description: Sutter is a decent dive bar right next to Montgomery Station.  The drinks are average price and quality; for some reason well drinks always seem to be cheaper than beer.  They have two pool tables that always seem to be occupied.  This is the kind of place you go to kill time before jumping on your train or the place you meet up with your friends before going somewhere else; not really the kind of place to hang out at.
author: D D.

description:
Pretty cool place on a Saturday night, I did notice the diversity of the crowd reminded me as if I were back in North Carolina (Mainly caucasian). Maybe I just came on a wrong day/night :)

I would come back here again, I was told to swing by for "Sutter Gutter", it should be entertaining...maybe... :)
author: Eric A.

description:
It is a dive bar........ and you're are not in Kansas anymore. The neighborhood is not all that safe. My friend and I been walking around the city and she got tried. So, we stop in for beer and The Lakers game. The bartender are really friendly. The bathroom is close to immaculate for a dive bar. Please keep in mind we were at the bar on a Tuesday night.

CHEERS!
author: John A.

description:
This was my second stop while barhopping on my way to the art gallery opening event downtown last night.  Ah yes, the Sutter Station...I'll never forget my first office job, fresh out of college at Citicorp Center.  Right across the street was Sutter Station so it was a great place to meet up with drinking buddies after work as a starting point.

With two decent coin-op pool tables in the back and doors at both ends (Sutter and Market), this place is a trashy dive (in a good way) right in the heart of the financial district.  The bar area itself has a great old school vibe that I like.  As for the patrons...well, it's certainly interesting.  Definitely not upscale or see and be seen, but it's truly eclectic and there's a little of everything in here.

Had a couple Absolut screwdrivers in here last night before heading to the galleries and they were sufficiently strong, certainly not watered down...thats for sure.  Even got a couple of games of pool in...how could I complain?  I have to say 3.5 stars.
author: Roy N.

description: I've been here multiple times and love this dive bar!  It's right next to Montgomery Bart which is good for me.  The bartenders have always been nice to me and it's so low key.  It's a dive bar people, and it's what i appreciate about it.
author: Amanda K.

description:
This was an interesting find in the downtown area.  Cheap drinks, very friendly bartenders, and very... urban.  It's ghetto, and only sorta fab.  So it doesn't really qualify for ghetto-fab.  It's your own slice of downtown Oakland in San Francisco.  

Overall, Sutter Station is a good, chill, divey spot that is worth a visit when you want a cheap, relaxed, neighborhoody bar to hangout at.  It certainly can get very B&T around here (if they took BART from the East Bay, they went through a tunnel), so know what you're getting yourself into here.
author: Leo C.

description:
Straight solid 3 stars...if they took cards 4 stars.

I'm in the FiDi near 2nd/Market...I want a drink...I'm tired of seeing the automatons...where do I go?

Essentially each choice is pretty good...it'll be the nuances that you prefer that day that will steer you.

You've got Dave's, Dada, Sutter Station, and Louie's within a block and half radius.  Actually pretty decent predicament to be in...

So on some occasions I'll pick Sutter Station.  

So the nuances that steer me to them on some days: No automatons.  Heard Pharcyde's "Passin' me by" the last time in...always a good happy crowd...bartenders are quick and on the ready.  Great place for a drink before heading wherever to meet whomever.  Damn....I mean damn close to Muni and the #7 stop.  Like totally within stumbling distance.

So the nuances that steer me away on some days: $8 Grey Goose on rocks...I'm mean c'mon...for a place that doesn't take cards that is just balsy.  Sometimes too packed and crazy loud. Odd bar set up...I feel if I'm way in the back I may never make it out again! And it is cash only....lame.
author: Chris D.

description:
Sutter Gutter!
I always like going here, its dark but comfortable, small but not cramped and the bartenders are friendly.  Due to its location it is a great last stop before catching a bus or BART train home.  If you don't like it you are probably stuck up and the other patrons there probably don't want to hang out with you anyway. 

This is a dive but if you are a FIDI tie wearer or tourist don't be afraid, the crowd is always mixed and a always friendly, don't be intimidated!
author: J. B.

description: I like this place because its a centrally located FIDI spot and is right on top of Bart/Muni. Beers are cheap and the crowd is mellow. They have a jukebox and a pool table. They bring pizza in regularly for the crowd to snack on too, which is nice. The only issue is that there is ONE restroom. Yes, only one, so if you have to go, get in line before it's an emergency. Cash only!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
One of the few bars with a back-door entrance, if you know what I mean.  They don't call it the Sutter Gutter for nutin'.  Don't buy a lottery ticket, and don't stick around for the lingerie show.

The only redeeming qualities are that the clientele are in general pretty friendly for a bunch of drunks, and you can get a game of pool in if it's not too crowded.  Oh, and the restroom is actually pretty clean, or at least appears so.
author: Andy B.

description: Sutter Station is a solid go to bar to watch a game, get some drinks after work, or play a game of pool with some friends.  Overall the scene is a dive, drinks are STRONG and affordable (3$ Well drinks) as well as food specials all week! Bartenders are very busy and professional but not necessarily personable to the younger crowd there. Bathroom has a long wait often, and on busy nights its hard to find a table.  Drop in and see if you like it when your near Montgomery Bart, leave after a drink if its not your cup of tea.
author: Max K.

description: Been going here for years. I love it. Barbara the owner is almost always there she is great. Door man is cool as well. One of the only bars in this area open regularly. Most others aren't open on the weekend.
author: Chris R.

description:
There's a sign on the front that says something about how they show football games or something that says something like "The place where friends and fans meet." 

Well let me tell you something: If you wander into a bar on friday night drunk enough that you're eating a microwaved 7-11 carne asada burrito and really enjoying it, a true friend would snatch it away from you, cut you off, and put you in a cab. There are no friends at Sutter Station, only worthless enablers.

It's a little slice of the tenderloin in the financial district. It kind of looks like a denny's circa 1978, only instead of grand slam breakfasts and waitresses that call you hon there's cheap beer and tore up looking women who wander up and down the bar asking male patrons to loan them $20.

You should totally go, you'll love it.
author: matthew r.

description:
Liquid Lunch anyone?

Sure, it is Friday after all, so what better way to spend your lunch hour than in a dark ass bar with shady looking people, mixed with out of place tourists and an old lady hitting on a young lad at the bar? I can only think of a few better ways, myself, but for this Friday, this was the right choice. 

Need more incentive? Okay. How about a bar that also offers a few hipsters, a guy at the music box who looks like his favorite band is probably Andrew WK and he would start a bar brawl just for kicks. Or how about a really obnoxious guy in a yellow R Bar cap using hip catch phrases like "Dawg." What? You still need more? Allllright, how about some lunch that comes from a business next door that at best would be described as meh.

Did I sell you yet? Did I? Cool, see ya there.
author: Stephy S.

description:
This is a tough one for me. 

My coworkers and I use to come here every other week during 2005-2007 to get bombed and bitch about the work week. We became regulars and had an in with the owner/ bartender Barbara. She is the type of person that would be an excellent friend but cross her and she will smack you right in the mouth. This is a dive bar in the financial district with a good mix of homeless people, business types, pimps and construction workers. They use to have two for one drinks specials during the week that we use to take advantage.

Then all of a sudden they increased the drink price way too high for a dive bar. I mean if I am going to pay 7.50 for a captain and coke then I want some atmosphere and less of a risk of getting shanked. 

Things I have seen in my tenure

Pint glasses full of captain and coke. 
Free Pizza/food on Fridays
Raffle ticket girl
Tinny pool tables
Someone getting carted off in an ambulance at 5pm from over drinking
Tamale Lady
Business men that need their whiskey fix before they go home to see their family
Patron shots with Tabasco
author: Jeff P.

description: My favorite bar on the planet. While it has cleaned up its act, it's still a dive. So don't come here if you want to sip an insouciant pinot grigio. This is a bar for hard liquor and beer. The beer selection is very good and, with liquor, the pour is as heavy as a sherman tank with a rhino on the hatch. Pool tables in the back. A juke box. Free pizza on Fridays. A number of hot looking bartenders. Want to do some serious drinking? Go to the Gutter.
author: Jeff P.

description:
This bar is getting a Yelp rap it does not deserve.  The bar is comfortable, with a good crowd and terrific service.

The Bar.
Huge, with two pool tables, full bar, bar seating and also tables, good jukebox and great service.  Candles lit in the evening and free snacks available on request.  The bar is nicely located, with terrific bartenders, friendly customers and inexpensive.

The Bartenders.  
They are friendly, meaning they are witty, conversational and smile often.  Even on your first visit you and the bartender are on a first name basis.  Secondly and maybe more importantly, they are efficient.  Drinks are served right away.  I've never had to wait for a drink and this place gets busy.  Lastly, they are competent.  They know how to make drinks and are generous.  

Now the Patrons.
 A lot of professional regulars come here, as well as other regulars.  It is a great after work spot.  I think more of the regulars need to get on Yelp and elaborate on why this bar rocks.  

I'm a fan and am surprised by the general rating.  More patrons should review this spot to offset the one timers that were drunk when they stumbled in.
author: Brandon E.

description:
My best friend is a drunk named Arnold. We've been through a lot together. Arnold likes to call me drunk from Sutter Station most days after work to get the poop, the scoop, the haps about town. Usually he just ends up drinking there more and going home. 

This past Friday, post-meeting and pre-dyl, I happened by Sutter Station and ventured in to see if my dear friend was anywhere to be found. Unfortunately, I didn't find Arnold. FORTUNATELY, what I did find was a Tenderloin bar magically transported to the Financial District, complete with pool table, a strong stench of stagnant urine, and plenty of gin-blossomed regulars. My, were they merry for 5 p.m. on a weekday! Good god, they must have started early! It takes a lot of booze to forget the long, hard work week before the sun's even gone down. These are my kind of people.

Wait. Not really. But at least I know it's there if I need it. This is more of an "in-case-of-emergency" kind of joint.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Wow I can't believe that I have never written a review for the sutter gutter.  One of the best bars in the city and it has changed dramatically over the years.  What was once a seedy stopover on the way to the office after a night of binge drinking has turned into a respectable establishment.  I never thought I'd see the day but it has happened.  I really like the "gutter" for a lot of reasons particularly the staff, and my fond memories of the early 2000's; however my favorite thing about the Sutter Station is their motto:
"Come on a Stranger, Leave as a Fiend."
author: Anthony Y.

description: Pretty great dive. First time here; snagged a pint from 101 North Brewing--a brewery I haven't tried or seen on tap elsewhere in SF so far. So they already get points for that. Pool tables, a loud but not raucous crowd, and free snack table because that's what they do on Fridays. I was wondering around FiDi precisely looking for a spot like this and happened upon it--glad I did.
author: Steve B.

description:
I have been here before, maybe midday, maybe on a weekday, maybe at lunch to play a few games of pool. No, I am not a lush - I drink $3 sodas on those days (complete highway robbery). I never think to come here for happy hour because I have a few other spots I frequent, and we all know I dont often hang in this hood in my precious evening hours. 

Well, came here for happy hour. It was happy and full of yelpers - hooray! 

They make some SERIOUSLY strong ass mixed drinks here - I was halfway to looped after 2 Sapphire and tonics.

So that is where the stars come from. Why did I take three away, you ask? well.......

One restroom, one unisex restroom. This is a bar. Don't they understand that once you break the seal that you will be needing to use that restroom every twenty minutes? I am guessing on an average day there are about 30 people drinking in this establishment. If each of them has to use the restroom 3 times each hour there is no statistical possibility of no line. Get a second bathroom.

WTF is with the washed up, scantily clad ex strippers selling raffle tickets for some crappy elusive piece of lingerie tucked away in the basement somewhere???

Though this place does not technically open at 6am it deserves an honorable mention on that list since it does open at 7 and has some of the crustiest drunks hanging out there at that hour. Viva morning drinking!!
author: Drue C.

description:
Sutter Station is a little pocket of ghetto right in the heart of the Financial District. Usually I have to walk to Sixth street or the Tenderloin if I want to be offered drugs by homeless people -- but Sutter Station is much more convenient!

For as shady (and smelly) as this place is, they still charge just as much for drinks as anywhere else. Why would anyone choose to come here?
author: Aaron V.

description:
There were no problems at all for me here, although I didn't go on a lingerie night.  In general I think that sleaze should visit a place for drinking and not necessarily set up camp.  Anyway...

Since on my first round I was asked about wanting a sugar rim on my cocktail - the thoughts or possibility of this is being truly a dive bar are gone.  This is not a cocktail lounge nor a true dive.  It is a full service bar that is dark and sometimes dank the way - you know, the way a bar sometimes should be.  

Single facilities - that is a drawback.  Time yourself, skip the beer, go earlier and/or then go elsewhere.  Ahhh, acceptance of business' reality is a good thing - it leads to a more basic enjoyment of one's current surroundings.
author: .Hazel T.

description:
(Checks phone for Monty Station BART arrival) Hmmm... I have time for a beer. If only there was a bar nearby... Oh, look! A bar!

It's quite... rustic. Pool tables, decent taps (Berkeley's finest, Trumer Pils, tonight), and (most importantly) it's steps from the BART.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I've found the perfect recipe for an early happy hour:

1 part - Late Friday Afternoon
1 part - Lazy Boss who leaves early & always takes time off
4 parts - Coworkers who are also fed up with their job

Mix with one super sleazy FiDi dive, and add stale popcorn & chips for extra flavor.

----

This place may take the cake for grungiest dive bar I've ever visited. I've been here on a number of late afternoons since I moved to San Francisco, and it always smells funky. The clientele is always quite interesting--suits, wandering tourists & even the FiDi homeless population. I've actually been panhandled while sitting at the bar, the dude was short like 50 cents for a glass of wine. Best part about this... the White Stripes playing bartender saw him, and seemingly shrugged it off as normal daily activity in the "Sutter Gutter".

There's pool tables in the back, a disgusting bathroom which often garners a line of 5 or more people during happy hour & lingerie night like Starla D mentioned. 

This joint is for the serious dive bar aficionado, I imagine it has scared many unsuspecting tourists & Marina types away in the past. Give it a go...and if it's after 3pm on a Friday, I may be right there next to ya!
author: matt m.

description:
The FIDI is like Circe in Greek mythology. Once drinking and sex gets tied to money, escape is very difficult.

VODA was the first time DYL came to the FIDI. The next DYL could not escape the lure of lucre and returned to the FIDI.

As soon as I enter Sutter Station, I realize that there is something seriously wrong with the energy flow, in other words, bad feng shui. I want to mingle with the yelpers but the physical layout of this Bar is so bad that I can't move from one end to the other without stepping on someone's toes.

I got pissed off by some scantily clad ex-strippers trying to sell raffle tickets. I got further pissed off(with the huge lines) when I tried to head to the(only one) bathroom and take a piss. 

Normally, I am very enthusiastic in going to a DYL. This time, making as fast an exit as possible was the object of my enthusiasm. In other words, the gravy train of DYL has hit the gutter @ the Sutter Station.

So what is the future of DYL? Are we to borrow some lines from The Doors and say

"This is the end
Beautiful friend
This is the end
My only friend, the end"

I am more optimistic and have greater faith in Todd E's leadership than that. The essence of Leadership is resilence and out of this crucible, will emerge a newer, stronger, drunker and  hornier DYL.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Sutter Station is something to remember not unlike my first love ...

Someday  I'll move away from the Bay Area and if it ever gets mentioned I will deffinitely remember it ...

It's similar to when my first love wanted to go to first base and I said no ....

My second time after discovering that they definitely didn't have a wine selection I gave in to having a beer ...

And after realizing that I liked kissing I was definitely on to the next base...

My third time took me to a new height  when my boyfriend had a surprise waiting for me with his sexy new sports car with reclining seats...

Fourth time I suddenly realized I actually liked the lighting and the Long Island Iced Teas...

I haven't been five times yet ...

But the new car smell,  mmm...

I think I need to talk to my parents,  I really wasn't raised this way...

However I think I like it....!
author: Katherine N.

description:
This is easily my favorite bar in SF.  After spending the day working in the financial district, it is an amazing refuge from almost every other bar nearby where the evening is invariably spent talking with people who take themselves way too seriously, over tiny drinks with insufficient olives.  I hate martinis with insufficient olives.  

The staff at Sutter makes fantastic martinis with lots of olives.  The atmosphere is so chill that most nearby professionals instantly vaporize if they're inside for too long.  This means there is little chance you'll run into anyone who wants to talk about the staggering amount of convertible venture debt lately...  on the other hand, most everyone will know the exact context of the game currently on one of several plasma screens.  The staff is extremely friendly and brings out free food a couple days a week... which you'll appreciate after realizing their drinks are stronger than you think.  

I'm not sure why everyone is complaining about needing to take a shower after coming here.  This place is as clean as any other bar in the city... just because it's dark and the surfaces aren't shiny doesn't mean the place is dirty.  Just don't touch the guy lying around the entrance outside - he is probably dirty.  Yes, it's downtown SF, there are homeless people... not a big deal.
author: Joseph S.

description:
This place has the worst beer on tap in SF, I fear. Not the selection (although I wasn't too fond of that) but the stuff that comes out of the tap is bad for even what it is. Oh well.

Oh well, it's a dive, and they really take that to heart. And I appreciate it, so they get 3 stars. But that's mostly just for being an overachiever in diveness. Happy hour is a madhouse, but a bit after, on a weeknight, the crowd things out. Or we thinned out the crowd. Maybe. 

Get in line early for the bathroom, before your bladder is going to explode. There is only one, unisex. And buy your beer in bottles. I will, when and if I go again.
author: neil c.

description:
A dive bar it is!

Wheeee I had sooo much fun! The drinks are soooo strong here - I mean, really, you only need a coupla drinks. 

No real dance floor but I managed to dance the night away!! 

One bathroom for everyone at the bar :o( This includes the drunks, the homeless, the shady, the ladies, the machos, the dorks, the loser, the users, the sober and the dancers. 

I liked the bar so much that I was one of the last Yelpers to leave! Wait, I really don't know why I stayed so long. Luis described me as onrey because I refused to leave the bar. Hmmmm...

I guess I love this place?!
author: Aim E.

description:
Sutter Station doesn't do much for me: it's a dive bar, and they charge $8 for a Dewar's & Ginger.  That's too much for a place that has a lingerie show in the back room you gotta pay $10 to get into.

Of course the flip side of this is that it's also the kind of place that's proud-ish of a 2-star rating.  If that's the kind of place you're looking for...well then it might do the trick for you.
author: Oliver N.

description: I came by here after a meeting with some co-workers and potential clients.  Friendly people, friendly staff.  Small local dive bar, with a pool table in the back.  Years back it was so ghetto.  Nowadays, you find business men and women trying to enjoy the rest of evening hours before heading home. Nice spot to unwind after a long day.
author: Becky U.

description:
i knocked off a star because their happy hour doesn't seem to have any cheap drinks. what's the point? but the place was packed with an eclectic crowd. a couple on the stool next to me (yes, two people on one stool) had what would pass as a full honeymoon in orange county and everyone seemed just happy enough. they said there was some lingerie auction but i preferred to think there were just fat girls walking around  who suck at strip poker. at least they were wearing big grandma drawers.

good times, good times.
author: Brian B.

description:
On a day when all you really want to do is go to your local bar and get a Bloody Mary, you should do just that... even on your lunch break of 15 minute break... it's honestly so worth it.   

I was feeling ill... no not hung over, sick =(  I would have been happier with hung over because there would be a lot less Kleenex involved!  But anyways I came here and had a not great but OK Bloody Mary that honestly let me breath again and feel much better.

Thanks Sutter Station for being open for people when they really need you.
author: Megan L.

description:
Sutter Gutter indeed!

I used to work downtown and have faint recollections of possibly catching a glimpse of this place at one point or another, considering I walked by it almost everyday for like 4 years.

Leave it to DYL to introduce me to this place that feels like a blast from the Market Street past.

The drinks are strong and I was surprised that they had decent top shelf offerings.

Wait! WTF did they put in my drink?  Did I just see a hooker in a g-string and fishnets selling raffle tickets from a happy birthday bag?

Kristine did you just see that? 

Carla...you kiddin me right?  they work here?  

Me A please tell them to leave me alone....I'm GAY dammit!

Five stars for the company of Yelpers!
Minus three for the horrendous TL quality lingerie models.

Todd I am still bustin up!

Hey Adam, where did we meet again?

Ed and Luis, WTF, we missed you!
author: A P.

description:
Dive bar... very divey -- a hangout for guys, mostly older guys starting at 11am in the morning.  Overall, great, fun crowd!  

After  stressful day at work last Friday, a few of my co-workers and I decided to check out Sutter Station since our work place is only a few blocks away.  It wasn't too crowded, there was a buffet of free food, pool tables, empty bar stools and tables to sit with friends.  

The guy bartender was friendly, nice and funny.  One of the woman bartender wasn't as nice, friendly or funny.  I was bummed that they ran out of mint because I really wanted a mojito.  Instead, I got a shot of fernet with a ginger ale chaser, then topped it off with Pilsner to end the night.  

During the raffle drawing, one of my co-workers won a pair of leopard print thong... so random, weird and at the same time appropriate because of the laid back, comfortable atmosphere.  

Two quick drinks is the way to go.  Done and done, I cannot imaging staying at this bar longer than that or at least I prefer not to...
author: Celeste M.

description: This place is always packed, even during the middle of the day.  They serve one of the few honest drinks in town, and so yes, it can get dicey in here.  But really, all kinds of San Franciscans come in here to knock one or two back.  Clientele really runs the gamut.  Bartenders are friendly and down to earth, especially for SF bartenders.
author: Dave N.

description:
This is like the ugly guy you think is cute after a night of drinking. But you haven't started drinking yet.  You are just dizzy from a long day of work.  It looks like a good idea, but you should really leave.

Oh, and I found a BUG in my bloody mary.  I was stoked about my bloody buddy and then wanted to puke.  Yes, a little creepy crawler in my cocktail. Awesome.
author: S L.

description: "hen a. hits it 700 times"....oh yeah...such a yelp slut...and what a way to celebrate with a bang than at the sutter station...destroy your liver (dyl) tour 1/19/07......happy hour after work at this dive looking joint without the happy hour prices.....speedy bar service....potent long island~!....woooo....!@#@$%$%.....this double entrance...narrow beer and drink hussling.....pooltable room having..dive bar is in the outskirts of union square....entrance on market...and another on sutter....drink up folks....it's crowded and friendly....and a perfect stumble and roll down to the bart/muni station bar.....
author: Hen A.

description: Snuck off to Sutter Station during work yesterday so that I could catch the second half of the SDSU basketball game (first tourney win in school history, ya baby!). I managed to return to work under the radar, but I won't be sneaking off to Sutter Station again anytime soon. It's dirty, loud, only takes cash and is filled with a lot of, shall we say, "interesting" people. Not really my kind of scene. It's a no frills bar with a couple pool tables in the back if that's what you're looking for...
author: Gina C.

description:
What the hell is this place doing on Market Street?

I went here for a quick wet of my lips before heading back home after work today, and I'll be damned if this place doesn't kick a fairly significant amount of ass for what it is: a simple little dive bar in the middle of downtown San Francisco!

The bartenders are just as good here as anywhere else; nothing to really write home about there. The beer selection is the same: 5 or 6 beers on tap, and nothing exotic or unusual. Or cheap, for that matter; it's the usual price of 4.50.

So, why on earth am I giving this place 4 stars instead of the 2 or 3 it honestly deserves? Because of it's location. Places like Sutter Station epitomize the draw and glory of San Francisco as a whole: diverse, unexpected and just a bit crazy. 

I'm glad seedy, shifty bars are allowed to exist in the strangest of places, and for a bar this shifty and seedy, downtown San Francisco on Market is the perfect home for it.
author: Adam M.

description:
I am not a fan of this place. The bartender was kind of a bitch and the drinks are way overpriced... either because they're trying to support the druggies who frequent this place or trying to get the regulars out of jail for ... wait for it... drugs.

Only upside is that it was close to work... but so are so many other places that won't overcharge and then panhandle for a guy in jail.
author: Megan P.

description:
Nice after-work dive bar.  I believe have been there for decades.  Not my kind of bar but the staff is nice and the people are as well.

A little hole in the wall good to go there from time to time, but not a favorite!
author: Kevin J.

description:
This placed interestingly in between the hustle and bustle of the financial district. Perfect for people who has walking around in the area late at night and want to stop and have a quick drink... but I wouldn't stay here longer than an hour at most.  The place is pretty small, has limited seating, and has a pool table or two in the back.  

I stopped here a couple years back with group of friends from college and decided that it was only useful to have one beer and to take a piss.  The drinks aren't overpriced and the people here were relatively friendly, but SF is so diverse you can't go wrong. Although I haven't really been back inside here since then, but I believe the only way you can have a decent time here is to randomly stumble upon it to have our last drink of the night like our group had before leaving the city.
author: Kenny P.

description:
It was the one time I hit the jackpot on the one-armed-bandit of on-line dating.  Her name was Vicki, and my jaw dropped in amazement when we first met sight unseen at Sutter Street Station.  She was incredibly cute...and a sweetheart too! It was the one of the few times in life where I placed the coinage of effort-invested into the match.com slot machine and the reels didn't come up all lemons.  Two beers and a ten minute stretch of idle chat had things going in the right direction....Then out of nowhere come a passel of underwear-clad women that looked like the "before" pictures in a Jenny Craig weight loss ad.  I tried to tune it out....but the whole thing got sort of up-close-and-personal when an overly-buxom woman sporting an outfit that looked like something straight off the discount rack at Fredrick's of Hollywood came sauntering over to our table. She flashed her best come-hither grin asked if we wanted to buy raffle tickets for the outfit she was modeling.  Great environment for a first date, no?  I'm a fast drinker....and luckily Vicki was too.  Come the bottom of our glasses, we didn't stick around for another....

Sutter Street Station is the Financial District's last down-and-dirty after-work bar.  If you want to get grittier, you've gotta head South to SOMA or make tracks Westward to the Tenderloin.  In another part of town, Sutter Street Station might pass for a neighborhood bar....but as we all know, there's no neighborhood at Market & Sutter.  It's prime location less than 50 yards from Montgomery BART makes it convenient for commuters, and the fairly large seating capacity does a good job of handling rush-hour crowds.  The place gets hit with the downtown after-work crowd around 4:30pm on weekdays. The rush lasts till 7:00 or so, then starts dying out...quick.  A few hardcores hang out in the morning, there's a brief wave at lunch, then things quiet down till around 4 PM or so when the rush hour starts.  By 8:00PM, all the commuters have long since hopped on their mass-transit of choice, and anybody looking to party into the night doesn't stick around.  

Sutter Street Station has a good location.  That's about it.  Dingy, Dark interior.  Hit-and-usually-miss crowd.  Higher than average beer prices, and dead any time other than 4pm to 6pm.  It's dooable during the rush hour...but there's little reason to pop by during the weekend.  And if you're meeting a first date somewhere downtown after work, be warned....last I checked, the underwear shows are still a weekly thing....and age hasn't improved the women who partake in them.
author: Mike W.

description:
Its a goof to go there.

I used to work across the street from there, and when I went out for coffee one morning my boss asked me if I could find her a Virgin Mary drink. 

I went out and noticed that at 10:30 in the morning Sutter Station was open. So I go in. The bartender, this I think german woman had real attitude. She made me show her my ID even though I clearly looked older than 21, and was asking for a non-alcoholic drink. She thought maybe i had a flask in my purse she said and wanted to make sure I was of age. I found this humorous, and showed her. Flattery right? (Oh sure sure...)haha 

She gave me the drink and it became a regular thing. Every morning she carded me, every morning she gave me the drink in a white styrofoam cup. I guess we know what she was having for breakfast..

I think this bar is cool. The lingerie shows are....well....lingerie shows. You have good nights and bad nights. Its not where I would choose to get /win my *evening wear*, but that's just me, and certainly not why I go there. Tho its always a surprise.

Its fun to drink in there, there is always popcorn or pretzels to devour, and a vast array of people from the shady characters out back & in the pool room to Matt Gonzales.

People who don't like seedy bars should not go to Sutter Station. I hear they serve lunch now.
author: Marz W.

description:
My first visit to Sutter Stationwas the day our company moved into a new building. It was Saturday afternoon, raining, and some coworkers and I were sent off to get pizza for the move-in crew. We decided to first check out the bar. Walked in, dark, a bit gloomy, two guys seated at a table playing dominoes. We bellied up to the bar and asked if there was a place to get pizza nearby. The bartender gave us a menu and said she'd call their place if we wanted. We ordered two bloody marys and a Corona while we waited. 

And then something strange happened. The heavens opened up and angels sang to me. The jukebox called for me to play every hairband sing along song, followed by something by Travis Tritt, and wrapped up by definitely something by Chingy.  We have been going back to SS for the past two years, nearly every Friday with plenty of other days of the week as well. I go to SS BEFORE going to other bars. I want my cheap vodka soda, and I want some free pizza and lumpia.

Sure it's seedy. Yes it sometimes smells like pee. And ya, I am pretty sure that the guy who used the restroom before me was shooting up. I don't care. The drinks are strong, priced fine by me, and I love the staff. SS is a place where everyone has to come down a notch. Everyone has come down a notch. You're not sipping on fine wine or looking at questionable art pieces; you're sitting in a bar trying to get loaded. If you're not down with that, simply go elsewhere. 

It's not a place to see pretty people. It's not really a place to watch a game (even though they just got a great flat screen and it's mounted high enough to possibly see an entire game without having to ask the lingerie girl to move over). It's a place to get drunk with friends and coworkers and then stagger outside to BART, a bus, or a taxi. 

I love you Sutter Gutter, with all my vodka soaked heart.
author: Michelle B.

description:
This place smells like dirty socks and the bar staff are sour and nasty. I really can't think of any redeeming quality for this bar, it is close to my work but there are so many other bars nearby that this place doesn't deserve my patronage. 

I'm never one to turn down an invitation to bask in the glory of happy hour unless this spot is on the ticket. I'd rather go to Eddie Rickenbachers with their beer soaked carpet and borderline racist decorations. 

Sutter Gutter.
author: Adrienne P.

description: Terrible staff, weak drinks, very smokey, no plastic accepted, so dirty felt like I would need TB test afterwards, owner looks ridden hard & put away wet (depressing), did I mention the unprofessional & rude staff. Don't waste your happy hour on this hole!
author: wckdkoolbtxh m.

description:
This is more than a dive, but less than the gutter. It's like, the curb outside a sewer grate by the gutter sometimes--but fun.

Don't take mom there. Don't take a client. Don't take your boss. Go alone or with your beefy bodyguard friends. You'll probably meet someone there anyway, there's a strange sort of commraderie there, like "There's a reason I'm stuck to this bar stool, and I hope it's not from the previous person that sat there".

The bartendars are nice, sometimes the patrons rowdy, but mostly friendly (if you like being propositioned and tempted to visit the back alley way). I've seen way too many couples enter the restroom together and the drinking apparently starts pretty early.

I've been there a few times since I work in the area (yes, I've gone back!), and it never fails to leave me with a story or random event to question. I've seen the lingerie shows, and if you count snaggletooth fishnets and mixmatched panties, then that's what you get. The girls are nice enough but I kind of feel bad for the environment they're in, and no, they are not models. It's a living!

It was a stop on St. Patricks Day for me and let me tell you, the joint was jumpin an the Jameson flowin'...on both sides of the bar!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Someday I pray this place will burn to the ground or get condemned or something, leaving everyone uninjured except for the douchebags.

Let me reiterate: I love dive bars. This is not a dive bar. It's a toilet that serves overpriced hooch from dung-stained glasses.
author: Ronzlo L.

description: I love a good dive bar, you meet the most interesting people, and  the Sutter Station did not disappoint. Excellent atmosphere,  the staff was awesome,  and the prices were right. A definite must go when in SF!
author: W Graham U.

description: On of my favorite dives in SF. Right on Market and close to Embarcadero, this bar is easy to get to, promises cheap, stiff drinks and most importantly has a bathroom that the public can use! This is just a down and dirty city dive bar for when you need get water fast and cheap! Enjoy!
author: Jay K.

description:
The Good Ole "Sutter Gutter"

I thnk this has to be hands down, without question, the absolute worst dive bar in the entire city.  Not in a cool, trendy Mauna Loa, Buccaneer or North Star way either...this is just an absolute sh*thole.

The service is horrible, the drinks are expensive and the crowd is sketchy, way sketchy.  A blend of the financial set, some dealers off market street and generally a bunch of hardcore alcoholics getting a quick booze fix before hopping on BART to the East Bay.

But it was across the street from the Citibank center and has a pool table so I spent A LOT of time there and actually had my share of fun.

And they open early and had no problem building triple bloodies "to go" directly into the Venti Cups we'd snagged from the Starbucks next door for our Bloody Fridays at the office.

Now I was hanging there in the days before the lingerie shows, but the concept terrifies and arouses me simultaneously.

It's definitely a must see, if ya ain't been there yet you have no clue what a dive bar really is.
author: Jay W.

description:
We call it the Graveyard. 

Don't buy the raffle tickets, you DON'T want the prize!
author: Allan R.

description: Not even a cool dive bar, more like a really shitty sports bar.  Weak drinks. Yuck.
author: Ali B.

description:
I was waiting for my partner going to office for a meeting on Monday night. Too early, bored, wanna a beer. Such a nice little place, the girl bartender services everyone very quick, but not quite friendly...  oh well, I wasn't planning stay long, so it's alright. One thing I don't like: cash only! Ugh, personally I don't like the place where only takes cash. Besides that, 15 minutes experience was pretty comfortable though.
BTW, saw a sticker posted in the bar, made me finally decided to give here a 4 stars. It says"I'm not gonna drink anymore, won't drink any less either". Nice, very nice!
author: Flora F.

description:
cheap drinks
a hot blonde walking around in lingerie
a beat-up jukebox
pool tables
interesting crowd..... 

i really liked this place.
author: JoseLuis A.

description:
OK - yelper mafia...  I had enough!

We all know what you mean when you say ghetto... Yeah you don't feel like you fit in - so... Or-is " we work harder then you mentality "  while hiding in your silly sentences!

This is a real working mans bar- last night the folks that where there looked like they where having fun, they dance, they drank, and could give a s@hit about some yellow belly fool in  cheap thread's...

P.S. i mean you...
author: swys -.

description:
I am beginning to seriously question whether Yelpers know what a dive bar is....

By FiDi standards, this may be a dive, but it is, in reality, and old bar done in a style popular decades ago. There is a lot of older woodwork - not something generally found in a dive. The prices are low, and I suppose that probably attracts a lower-class crowd, and, as we all must admit, the lower classes in San Francisco tend to be exemplary.

The bar itself is not bad, really. The wifi is free, but appears throttled, so don't expect to get any serious work done in this.... bar.... Right, so, not much of an issue, I admit...

If you're looking for an unpretentious, old-school, east-coasty kind of place, Sutter should fit the bill.

Given the location and the pricing, I wouldn't be surprised if you wind up dealing with some of San Francisco's bat-sh1t insane local flavor from time to time, but hey, we all need a little entertainment, don't we?
author: C G.

description:
I've seen pretty much everything there--- the "lingerie"show, karaoke, purses stolen, many a fight, the crying guy in his suit at noon. ohhh the memories made at Sutter Gutter-- how can I not love you?

The german lady bartendress-- I call her Gretta-- runs a tight ship there, so don't give her no bad-attitude or she'll 86 your ass out of there.

The gutter is good fro what it is---If you need a quick lunch beer (or 2), or an afternoon "coffee" (or 2), it's just far enough away from the offices to make it work.
author: Pea H.

description:
SUTTER GUTTER!  

I've only walked in here to visit a friend.  She worked here as a bartender and I have to tell you how she got the job!  haha 

She's pretty HOT that a) they trained her to be a bartender, b) she pulled in serious $$$$, and c) she talked about Lingerie Thursday or Friday's  - they asked her to do it while she tended bar that's soo nasty! haha

She no longer works here, so I wouldn't even bother going in anymore.  

Oh the place:  your dive bar - dark, sleazy, alot of older men, and two entrances (Sutter & Market) , unusual mixed crowd (it's not just your straight FiDi crowd) .. OH THEY ONLY HAVE 1 BATHROOM!
author: Stel D.

description:
Ah, the Slutter Street Tavern, as my girlfriends and I like to call it.  We usually hit Slutter Street after way too many drinks someplace else.  Love the divey crowd, hate the skanky bathroom.  Never have seen the lingerie show, but have been invited to participate.  

Re the bad reviews - hey, what do you expect for a bar on Market Street?
author: .Hon H.

description:
Well... this hole in the wall bar is one of those "man... I really need a place to drink and have no where else to go" type of places.  You can get a really good... fat shot from one of the bartenders one moment and the next get a watered down small shot.  It's small.  Smells.  Most people in here are rude.  I once got kicked out for drinking a shot and then talking to my friend... because I was too drunk.  Its dark and dirty... as in bad meaning bad.  

On the upside, its right across the street from work.  Sometimes... beggars can't be choosers... but I'd have to be really lazy to not walk a couple of blocks in the opposite direction to another bar.
author: Ray P.

description: Good happy hour prices and pool tables. It's a dive bar and caters to that. Interesting people a good humored staff. A worthy place of stopping at if on Market and looking for a cold beer.
author: Kate D.

description:
Sutter Gutter, you're my only friend...

a no-nonsensery bar, get in there to get your stiff drink on, play some pool.  not for scaredy cats.  i personally like the random lingerie sales.  

the designated driver is right out front (38 & 38L), what more do ya need?
author: Mimi X.

description: I came in to this bar to kill an hour, while I waited for the 5 to get to the Western Addition for a housewarming party.  This is not a hipster bar and the clientele are just regular folks.  The service was friendly and fair.  I was able to charge my phone, use the restroom and enjoy a delicious IPA.
author: Naida E.

description: Awesome prices - great happy hour. Free wifi.  They have popcorn to snack on. You can't ask for much else.
author: Annie T.

description:
Pop Quiz!

This bar has...

A)  Mullets?
B)  Mullets on women?
C)  Blue Moon on tap, served with orange slice?
D)  A lousy jukebox?
E)  Random British men who will give you (ahem, me) $5 to spend on the jukebox ("so long as you turn off this shite")?
F)  A woman walking around in underwear, selling raffle tickets?
G)  Free pizza on Fridays?
H)  Free popcorn?
I)  All of the above?

Answer:  All of the above!  Everything you need in a post-work dive.
author: Sarah J.

description: This is what a dive bar is supposed to be like.
author: Michael E.

description:
Great for a down and dirty shot to your system. 

I'm a HUGE fan of dive-bars, but this place reminds me of a dive-bar more suited to the older crowd. My mom would love it! 

I noticed a set of pool tables in the back. She'd love that too.
author: Towanda S.

description:
This place is a total trip, it looks super seedy from the outside and once you go inside, guess what! It is! 
When I went there with a co worker there were girls in g strings and sheer body stockings passing out raffle tickets. We were like oops, did we unknowingly go into a strip club disguised as a bar? But nope, it's just a bar with stripper type girls in it but not actually gyrating to any music for any sums. It was kind of weird but fun.
author: Cathy T.

description: The Sutter Gutter has a reputation of being dark and dingy. Definitely not my preferred bar in the FiDi but my friends are successful in dragging me here after dropping money elsewhere on drinks. Expect to get more here: a generous pour, friendly service and an interesting and diverse crowd entering from both the back or front of the establishment. A no frills bar with a long history close to bart and muni along with two pool tables to work out your buzz.
author: Carmina B.

description:
Hey I have to say I grew up in oakland but I love the catalsyt in santa cruz. And this place is just as great. I  All the bartenders are cool I'm actually sittin here right now with Rebecca as the bartender...and she is one of the few that understands that in a dive bar its good to carry a good conversation with customers and patrons...Barbra the owner is great she works just as hard.

This is a great place to go if you are in the neighborhood and work in the area. The prices for drinks are reasonable and and they have some good beers on tap. I'm a fan of jameson and their prices are good.

You can kick it here with ur business co workers and the atmosphere is great. There is a jukebox that the bar contributes to sometimes. If you want to play some pool its all good u can do that here as well. There are no beggars outside and its right across the street from the bart station.

Come its a good lay back kick it time
author: Obie O.

description: This bar is described as being in the FiDi, but I wouldn't describe it that way. It has more of a TL feel, and it is facing Market St. We stumbled upon Sutter Station because we just needed a place to grab a drink while were wandering around Market, and this place looked seedy enough to make me curious. Plus the bars are a little more scarce in this particular block. We sat at some low tables with a booth, and watched the staff kick out a couple of underage girls. It's a bar that you can't decide what it's trying to be. When it's really hopping, I can't even tell you what the crowd is like. They have a normal selection of beers, decent seating, but no mirror in the bathroom. That sucks when you are vain and just want to look at yourself for a minute.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Uhm, I heart this place.  I can't help it.  Strong drinks, cozy seating, little bit dark and depressing... The unisex restroom, which requires giant key on a stick, is annoying, but whatever.
author: Stacey S.

description:
It seems with this spot you either love it or hate it.  Well I'm going to break that tradition and just say I'm on the fence.  I went there with Nish and the gang for lunch - yes lunch - and we had the place practically to ourselves.  The bartender was friendly and the "fresh" popcorn from this morning was actually kind of tasty, though stale.
  
Our lunch came from some place next door...cafe bianco.  It was pretty good as far as sandwiches go, although mine came with no mustard.  FYI: I LOVE MUSTARD.  It's alright though, because the owner of the cafe cheerily brought it right over.  

I'll have to try the drinks sometime.  Maybe I'll go after 1:00 pm.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I can get tipsy for $13 and then take BART home. What's not to like?

The crowd is a mix of business people, thugs and salt of the earth. Again: what isn't to like? The whiskey is poured generously and you never leave the safety of downtown. Have been there on some days (i.e. after 5:30pm but before 7:00) when it is packed and some when I've had my pick of seats.
author: Ross G.

description:
This is an update. 

Boy oh boy am I tired of the pretentious, snobby, need to be catered to mentality of many of the individuals who have yelped about this place. Yes, it is like a bar from Oakland in the heart of the financial district. Some would say the Tenderloin, but, it's not THAT grimy. Plus, to me, the Tenderloin has the best bars. 

Anyway ... get over yourselves!! This is my whole issue with San Francisco in a nutshell. Snobs who expect life to cater to them and their snobbish attitude. Kiss your own ass!!

Yes, it's more for the rugged personality. If that's not you .. go to snob hill!! 

Okay, now that I got that off of my chest ...

... the bartenders are not that cute. :) 

Half-naked women walking around taking dollar bills for raffle tickets is funny! 

I drink the well bourbon and it's good. 

I really like this place.

Word.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Don't expect too much when you hit up Sutter Station since its smack dab in the middle of the financial district where you'd probably expect a nice posh lounge.  SS is a hole-in-the-wall bar with pool tables and ample amount of seating.

the bartenders, bar backs and clientel are very friendly, which made it enjoyable.  SS might be a nice spot for a quick drink in a low-key scene; but I wouldn't necessarily plan my next birthday party there or bring my mother.
author: lasok o.

description:
This bar is def. a dive bar, but makes a stiff drink for a reasonable price.  The best night to go is Wed. because there's this lingerie show and it's sort of like a lottery drawing where you win a cocktail or lingerie.  The girls are always hot and the bar scene is shear entertainment!  

The crowd is a mix of business men from the financial district and the occasional gangster.  Everyone is nice and all have a smile on their face :)
author: Heather S.

description: I'd give this place five stars, but it's a dive bar, so how can I give it more? Three is as good as it gets and I grant them all. All I can say is that every financial district in every city in America should have its very own Sutter Station - a non-pretentious place to have a beer or stiff cocktail whenever you want. Step forth and take a bow, Sutter Station -- you've endured, just like that drunk down on the corner.
author: Joe F.

description:
one night here and I was impressed.  The long island iced tea is for real, none of the watered down stuff you get at the yuppie bars/clubs.  For 7 bucks I was thoroughly wasted to say the least.

I have to knock one star for the ambiance.  It's almost as if my dad walked into this place 30 years ago.
author: John D.

description: Meh, Its a dive. A dive with all of the typical characteristics of a dive bar. Depressing for the most part. Filthy, smelly and full of bitterness. The majority of the female bartenders have a truck driver attitude yet not all of them as... a couple of them are very sweet. The regulars during the day look like they have come straight out a Leaving Las Vegas scene. Construction workers on the lam, lawyers going through bitter divorces (from having had knocked up a young stripper somewhere, j/k), and stock/mortgage brokers not doing so well, all of whom are on a 4-5 hr lunch break? Then comes happy hour with the commuters and people finishing up their work days not wanting to run in to other coworkers or pay the inflated price of the other bars about. There are always seedy folk standing around the outskirts as it is right toward the end of Market near to the bus station. On the upside, the drinks are stiff. Drafts... common for the area as there really is no happy hour. Taking in to consideration that from a keg of beer at cost, the owner is paying 35- 40 cents tops per pint, charging $5 for a pint is funny. A staple bar for hardcore alcoholics with their designated stools and a staff that mostly only pays attention to their grumbling, stumbling down and out regulars. Come nightfall, it caters toward gangbangers and drug dealers. I pretty much have felt as though, I were in the Tenderloin or on Skid Row everytime, I have slipped through there. Felt like taking a shower from just peeping in from the outside.
author: Out O.

description: I dropped in the other night and to my surprise I was disgusted. My glass was dirty, the staff was rude, the blonde lady (who was acting like she owned the place) had to be on something. I usually don't go to bars where "crack heads" are all around but we were in the area. The bar  it self is dirty.  Hard to enjoy a drink from someone who has sores on their face. I will never go back.
author: Ellie C.

description: Yes, it is a dive, but it is fairy clean, and has good drinks. It is a little dark inside. This bar is 110 years old.  It was opened by my wife's great Grandfather, John Michael Ferris and his partner Max Cohen, March 12, 1910 ( an advertisement can be found in a copy of the 3/12/1910 San francisco Call newspaper).  The original name was :The Ferris" Cafe and Saloon.  Soon after, it was renamed "Sutter Station".  I am afraid the 18 amendment in 1919 ran poor John Ferris out of business at age 52.  It must have kept going somehow, because it is stills serving booze today.  So when you drink, you are drinking  surrounded by history
author: Roger B.

description: It kind of smells, but there's a pool table and a full bar. It's a total dive but in the perfect location for a quick drink with friends when you are on your way home. Sutter Station is right next to the bus stops and bus station and has two entrances on either side of the block... oh the convenience!!!
author: Kandace K.

description: By definition, you can't give a dive bar 5 stars.  But I would if I could.  Small little 'haunt' right off the Montgomery St. BART station.   Luckily, not too many of the douchebags from Harringtons or Royal Exchange make it over here thank god.  Same bartender been there for at least 20 years and she pours strong!   Don't bring all your friends here, just the few that you really like to hang out with.  I'm pretty sure there are money games on the pool tables in the back, and you can enter from Sutter or Market St.
author: Big Toe ..

description: I've always wondered who goes into this bar, it always seems so seedy despite being right on Market Street. Finally, went over for Friday Happy Hour and entered a world of shifty characters with a smattering of the young professional set, looking somewhat uncomfortable about how they ended up there. The bartenders are a surly but in a good way, and the drinks are stiff. Did I mention the lingerie "models" that are there every Friday and sometimes Thursday? They seem to be the sort of models that just might be available for a gentelmen (and I use that term loosely) looking for a nice escort around town, if you get my meaning. Then again, I don't really see a problem with girl-on-girl body shots done off a fleshy breast, do you?
author: Nish N.

description: Are you kidding? $12.00 for a Sapphire Gin and Tonic? REALLY? are you kidding me? This place is retarded. Never going back. Once more, this place is retarded.
author: Dustin H.

description: How can you not love Sutter?! If you're giving a bad rating you just didn't get it or you got 86'd...
author: Todd E.

description:
a fidi dive? well, i don't know about that, but sutter station (or sutter gutter as it is affectionately called) is where you go when you're in fidi and down on your luck. perhaps your tech portfolio hasn't performed the way you thought it was going to. maybe your best friend screwed you over.......or worse - your best friend is your boss.......and he slept with your wife. ouch! that sucks! really sucks! i know, i know. that's a cheap shot on our pretty boy mayor, but hey, i'm not the one who broke the man code.

anyway, if you're feeling sorry for yourself in fidi.......and want to know how far you can fall before finding yourself, sutter station will suffice. the drinks are reasonably priced but not cheap though. i mean, after all, this is still fidi. so if possible, tell your double-crossing "friend" that you're quitting and demand $15k per month until you find another job. oh, it's been done before.

http://www.nbc11.com/news/10954843/detail.html
.

and by the way, try to remember this quote when you hit rock bottom:

it's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up. -- lombardi
author: frisco j.

description: Kind of a letdown. Too bright, horrible layout, and a place that doesn't take VISA should not be charging me over 4 dollars for a well drink. What it reminds me of is a poor man's Gold Dust Lounge, a bar that is so much better than this shithole in every possible way. I will add that I appreciated that this bar had a very mixed crowd, and by very mixed, I mean that it is one of the few bars in SF I've been to that is not 100% white people so that was cool.
author: Maria D.

description: Sutter Station is one of the few financial district bars where all pretensions are left at the door - this place is not for posers, pretenders, or climbers.  If you are downtown, and you want a good drink, check it out.  Whitney is one of the best bartenders in the City (and she's pretty too!), and Roma, who runs the establishment, brings a charmingly surly Italian vibe to the bar.
author: Joe C.

description:
Don't go here if you're white.

Ok, I love me a good dive bar.  I prefer a good dive bar.  But, in order for me to like a good dive bar I need to actually be served at a dive bar.  So, here's the story: I came in with some friends after work and walk up to the bar to order a drink where I was informed that I would not be served because I was already "too drunk".  This came as a surprise to me since, you know, I wasn't.  I had, at that point, only had 2 drinks over the previous 3 hours and was quite a ways away from being "too drunk".

When pressed for an explanation, she said "look at you, you're white as a sheet, too pale, I can't serve you." 

My friend, who was with me, was served, and he had been drinking steadily for the previous 3 hours.  He is also Indian and decidedly not pale.

I didn't know being pale was a sign of inebriation.  I'm sorry, I'm a programmer in San Francisco; I don't get a lot of sun.

Anyway, I drank water.  At first they didn't want to serve me water, but since we had a party of 8 or so the bartender said I could stay.  The quality of the water was ok.  I'll give them that.  It was simultaneously cold and wet, which are two qualities I look for in water. 

In short, I think the bartender was just crazy and/or a bit drunk herself. I didn't raise a fuss because fighting with a bartender is generally a waste of time and effort.  I will not, however, go back. 

Unless I want some water.
author: Chris V.

description: Indeed, the new spot for Fi-Di HH...I can't remember what I was drinking, but it worked. In fact, I dont think it mattered at all...It was all about the visuals...live (and dive) lingerie show! It wasn't much of a show, but it was a spectacle... for reasons I will let you find out on your own. The lingerie models are cool chicks - physically accepting of trash/receipts, as well as dollar bills...who said models are vain?  I also noticed a number of fancifully attractive & polite men here- mostly back by the pool tables... lots of mustache...So, there's really no reason not to visit Sutter Station... Oh, but there's only 1 bathroom total- no worries though, i'm sure no one would mind sharing  :)
author: Nicole L.

description: Maybe my impressions will change if I came here more often.  But I liked it.  Dark, divey, decent seating, busy, but not too loud to have a conversation.  Other than their slightly high prices, it isn't too bad for an after work spot in the FiDi.  And the gals in lingerie?  That's a trip.
author: Marsha Z.

description: You gotta love a good dive bar located right in the middle of the city. Any bar with free wifi is a hit with me. Drinks were expensive though: $7 for Stoli. Seriously? My stop was an afternoon one, so I didn't get to experience the crowd or ambiance, but I could hang out there.
author: Alisa C.

description: I love this place for some reason--I walked past SS on my way to the Ferry Building and since my hotel didn't have free wifi, I planned an evening trip here to grab a brew and check e-mails.  I sat next to a regular at the bar and we hit it off.  Everyone seemed really friendly here and I liked the atmosphere.  My new friend bought me a beer and I returned the favor.  The bartender was cool and in five minutes of walking in, I was friends with like 5 people.  I will definitely come back here on my next visit.
author: Rob P.

description:
So plan accordingly... two things must be thought out well in advance..

Do i try the front, or back door.. (to have a smoke, get your mind out the gutta) 
JUST KIDDING! Either way its like a broken jack in the box, except instead of a puppet type deal jumping out at you, its a dirty agressive bum in search of cig buts or change. Sometimes you have to kindly step over them to get in our out. 
So i cant completely knock this place, the bartenders are generally decent enough, all though i have been in here a handfully of times and it never seems to have the same staff as before.. hmm wonder why..
might it be the shotty bathroom you have to wait in line for (one bathroom?? really are you kidding me?) guys= two seconds, women = 2 to 20 minutes for pee stop.. 
could it be the over the top drink prices, yes i understand you are close to the financial district.. but damn come on now..
it could be the clientele that seems to gravitate around this bar... 
oh but there is a breath of fresh air, POOL TABLES! 
no wait, they are all occupied by what appears to be some sort of mafia of old sleezy greasy looking men.. ack! 
this place definately takes the term "dive bar" and runs with it, and runs and runs and keeps on running...
author: jamie z.

description:
Seeing as though this bar is literally across the street from my work, I cant believe i haven't been here before. 
Went to the DYL.  It was super crowded on a Friday even pre-yelpers.  Took a while to get to the bar to get a drink, although once i got my drink i stopped complaining, because i honestly don't think my captain and diet actually had any diet in it.  One drink...buzzed.  Two drinks...drunk.  Also hadn't eaten before i got there which was probably a mistake.  
There was a very diverse crowd, pool tables in the back in addition to a back entrance that we chose to smoke outside of.  Apparently the bathrooms are gross?  I'm glad i didn't have to go.  Met some great yelpers at my first DYL, but took off somewhat early to meet up with some other friends, and proceed to get even drunker before making an ass of myself at Osha Thai (see review)
I may stop in here again for an after work cocktail...but purely for the convenience, not because i think its a cool bar.
author: Lauren F.

description: Stopped in during the middle of the day, and found a nice group of folks hunkered down having some drinks fixing problems in the world in a friendly manner.  Great service and low and behold it's right on Market Street in the City so it came as quite a surprise when we were walking taking in the sights.  If you have time and want a quick drink for reasonable (Bud Bottle $3) this is the place.
author: T L.

description:
Just read Brandon E's review, and he is right!

This place one of those bars that Cheer's was resembling. Everyone from Security to the bar backs know you. If you come more than one time, im pretty sure you will get to know the Bartenders. All of them are awesome (and pretty hot!) 

Beyond the STRONG (cheap in price) drinks, the gem of this place is the regulars. No matter how you day is going, someone has an ear for you. Ive never been to sutter and had a bad time! Pool tables are in the back, TV near the bar, and they always have the game on. No matter what the sport! 

Right next to bart and muni, two doors (front and back)
author: Eric F.

description: Never have I ever experienced anyone ruder than the manager of Sutter Station. I am organizing a massive bar crawl and wanted to use S.S. as one of our destinations simply because of its convenient location between Tunnel Top SF and Harlot. While some of the staff were cordial to me over the phone it still took forever to get a clear answer or any communication about their participation. THEN, I go in last night only to be yelled at and thrown out? We were going to bring 100 people here!!!! I know life can be tough but PLEASE. No way are we ever going here again and you shouldn't either. Support cooperative, friendly business owners!
author: Jessica M.

description: Friendly bouncer and cold beer. What more can I ask for. Yet, I need my $3 beer and so I am spoiled. Yet, I combined my two beers with good company and my Friday was good.
author: Jamie L.

description: You really don't have to be afraid of going in this place.  Are there shady characters in there?  Yep.  The shady-ness isn't overpowering though and the vast majority of the crowd is made up of non-button up shirt FiDi worker bees.  Friday night lingerie shows are something else, probably not in a good way though.  The bartenders have always been friendly to me and remember what I like to drink even though I'm not a regular there.  I love how you can walk by this place at 10am during the week and it's open.
author: Luis M.

description: The bartenders were excellent hosts attending to every need and making exceptional drinks. We had a terrific experience. We felt as comfortable as we would in our own home.
author: Kim K.

description: Definitely an interesting place. Would not choose to go here if it weren't for the location close to work. They pour generous, I mean, VERY generous shots, which I guess is a plus, but I see a LOT of hammered people here... not too classy. Also, they put out this very large box of pizza on some happy hour days. In our drunken states, my co-workers and I gladly devour these oddly shaped and extremely greasy pizza slices. Afterwords, we ALWAYS regret it. It gets pretty jam packed on Fridays after work, so I would avoid going here then if you don't like to hammer your way through people while getting beer spilled all over your shoes.
author: Janie Y.

description: Sutter Station has character.  It's not really the dive bar that I thought it would be, although it may look like one on the outside.  It's almost like an older Cheers.  Pool tables.  Jukebox.  And one f'n bathroom.  My DYL night started out headed straight for the bathroom, only to encounter a line about 6 deep.  Other than that, it's not a bad place to grab a drink and hang out.  I even liked it a little more than Voda.
author: JeFF T.

description: Pricey beers, mildly creepy patrons, occasional and accidental good music blaring from above.
author: Blake C.

description:
So last night I and a group of friends decided to go to the Sutter Gutter for a night cap after dinner. Bad mistake.
I was standing at the bar talking to my new friend about fighting for no particular reason (we have both trained in martial arts) and as if on queue a fight broke out behind us. Some drunk guy was acting a bit belligerent, so the bar owner came out to attempt to shut him up and get him to leave. A few minutes later he was attacked by no less than 6 guys who proceeded to beat the bloody hell out of him. I have never witnessed something like this in person and it was shocking to say the least. It almost turned into a full bar fight like you see in the movies. Two or three tables were overturned as the animals continued to beat the defensless guy to death. As if that wasn't enough, they then dragged the guy out of the bar by his hair. At that point he was motionless like a corpse as he probably was within an inch of his life. They kicked his head as they dragged him out. We didn't even want to know what they did to him when they got him outside. The cops and ambulance showed up shortly thereafter and we got the hell out of there. 
Folks, nobody should have to witness this kind of brutality anywhere. I'm not naive, but this was sickening to watch. What could have been so offensive to these shitbags that they needed to do that to another human being? 
So it goes without saying that I hold the venue partly responsible for this, and hence my one star. I have been in this place on a number of other occasions and the one thing I noticed besides the awful smells was the clientele, or patrons. There are only two types that hang out there - the financial district crowd eager to get a taste of "the other side", and those that belong in such a hell hole because that's all they've ever known in their miserable existence; the kind that would beat a man like they did for being drunk and belligerent. The bar owner should have a full time bouncer, and a big one at that. She's a tiny frail lady - these fights must happen a lot there, how does she deal with them normally? I won't be going back to find out anytime soon and if you value your life you shouldn't either.
author: Matt H.

description: Bar hopping continues...Went to this dive bar for some drinks.  It's a little thuggy near the pool tables, but otherwise, it's a chill place to hangout if you're a gangsta like me (lol).  Note: the gin and tonic was 99% gin.
author: Jeff H.

description: The Gutter Station as we used to call it had one good thing going for it.  It opened earlier than any other bar I know ... 10am.  I found this out one morning when the team I worked with at the time was off to a particularly bad start.  We decided to remedy the situation with a quick pick me up at the Gutter.  I was certainly thankful that day that the worst bartenders in town were there to open at 10am sharp!
author: Jumbo J.

description: Up until the double stabbing that occurred outside the back entry past the billiards, I was marveling at how close a decent dive bar was to my desk at work.  Someone had a pallet of pizzas delivered and we had some for free.  There was an ongoing raffle with sleazy prizes like lingerie, boxers, free drinks (FREE DRINKS PLEASE).  This was led by a lady with shiny booty shorts.  She had a costume change between each raffle and peddled various other wares.  I get free tickets, joyous day.  Didn't win, but enjoyed their Blue Moon x3.  Oh and step more than 2 feet away from the front wall if you're loitering outside on the phone or smoking... the birds are merciless with their poo-bombs.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
This bar is insane--in a good way.  I went there with a friend for the first time yesterday.  Two Stars for the fact that, for the first time since I've come to SF, I didn't have to pay for any of my drinks. Not that I expect men to buy me drinks and love paying for my own drinks, but when someone offers, I am not going to say no, dig?

The next two stars are for the fact that I met more interesting and friendly "characters" in 15 minutes in that place than my entire time in SF so far.  Cases in point: the wanna-be thugs with more fake bling than game who fell in love with me and a stripper selling raffle tickets (and God knows what else) who entertained my friend and I with her dating horror stories. And who "gifted" my friend and I with some lingerie that I so did not want but I'm sure will be a big hit with one of the nice working girls in front of Divas who are friendly to me and will be getting the teddy and thong set the next time one compliments me on my hair or outfits.  (Well, they are friendly to me except for that one time when I went for a classic rock and roll trashy look one night while strolling out to the Hemlock and realized from the nasty glares that I received from the "gals" that I should never wear a leopard fur jacket & heeled rocker boots--albeit with a Stooges tee and jeans--in my neighborhood again. Sorry gals, I was not on the make, I just wanted to work a female Keith Richards meets Kate Moss look that night.)  

Sutter Station is a weird downtrodden, random sort of place but it is a hell of a lot of fun. 

I think it is like Douglas Coupland wrote:  Only the disenfranchised and the freakishly beautiful can truly party with abandon.  Not that Sutter Station had any beauties that I saw, but it had a boatload of freaks and cheap booze and to me, that always means a fun night out.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Ok I had the greatest Friday Nite Happy Hour EVAH here. I enjoyed an Incredible Hulk while watching the lingerie models lick shots off each others supple soft boobies. Good times, no EXCELLENT times, in such a seedy bar. Where have you been all this time?!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Okay...I gotta review this place because it's right across the street from where I work.  The Dive of all Dive bars open at 10am ...I have to say the drinks are damn strong.   The lingerie show isn't too bad...they do walk around practically nude to get you to buy raffle tickets.  I think they actually have food, too. I wouldn't touch the stuff though...
author: Jay H.

description: Great place for a drink.  I usually hit this place up when I'm in town (the hotel I usually stay at is close by).  Good variety of beers on tap and there is always an interesting crowd on hand.
author: Louis B.

description: Wandered in after leaving Zebulon on Friday night.  Sucks they don't take credit cards, but it's a decent dive nonetheless.  I'd wander in again for one of those "Damn, I need just ONE more drink before I go home" drinks. ;)
author: Jay B.

description: I started off the night by saying, "I'm in a foul mood, I want a dark bar where they give me cheap whiskey in a dirty glass..." And my wishes were fulfilled and then some. An inconspicuous hole in the wall on Market Street, it's seedy and shadowy with a... lingerie show? Spent too much time in the Marina lately? Stop in here to experience a different side of life for a bit.
author: Michael E.

description: how can you go wrong with this place?!  cute bartenders, lingerie models, whacked out crackheads, all in a cozy dive bar setting.  We enjoyed a few drinks here before heading back into the night.
author: franklin p.
