description: 2nd shadiest spot in the FiDi (1st is the Jack in the Crack on 1st).  It should be stop #1 for people that get laid off...  The upside is that it's pretty cheap and it's definitely not high class - sometimes you got's to be in the DDL!!!
author: Paul J G.

description: This place is funny in a pathetic sort of way.  I came here with a friend of mine and we didn't know it was lingerie Thursday!  We were a bit shocked but we got a good laugh out of it!  Asked if we would come back, hell yeah!  Next time we are buying raffle tickets too.  But seriously, where else can you get a beer for 3.50 in San Francisco.  I'm a bit of a germaphob so the Sutter Station loses points for using nasty glasses that needed to be replaced 2 years ago.  Otherwise this bar is great!!
author: Brent G.

description: How can anyone not LOVE a bar where the bartenders are ALWAYS drunker than the patrons?  This feat--and it is a bona fide "feat," if you have ever seen the drunks populating this place--demonstrates a dedication to the craft that is beyond parallel in San Francisco.
author: A H.

description: This is probably the diviest bar in the Financial Dist./Downtown, but has a pretty legit clientele. Its a good place for law students, professors, and laid back business men to get STRONG drinks and not have to deal with the usual pomp and circumstance of some of the "high class" places in the area
author: Kyle M.

description:
always a good place to get an after work drink. sometimes the lingerie girls are there serving drinks which means i don't have to wait for eight drinks later, i can just puke right there right now after seeing those butterfaces.

there are pool tables there but i dare not play because they're usually occupied by burly men.

the jukebox plays adequate music.

it's nice getting drunk early in the evening because you get hit on by the patrons earlier, you know, instead of having to wait for nightfall.

and my last reason for liking this place, my mom used to frequent it when she worked downtown ten years ago.
author: Tatiana D.

description: This place is good fun.  Beware the lingerie night though.  Or, just have another cocktail.  Great post work happy hour joint.
author: J P.

description: I like the fact that the awesome Speakeasy brew (Big Daddy) is on tap, and there is a woman walking around in her underwear on Tuesday and Thursday nights.
author: KEVIN M.

description: A good after work dive bar. I drink here about once a month, I dont go out of my way, but since I work 1.5 blocks aways its a good place to drink. The crowd is usually more of a blue collar set with the professionals that look out of place. Dont get me wrong I wear a shirt and slacks for work as well, but being raised in the City you have a different vibe around you then a lot of transplants. I digress though, the older german lady serves the drinks with a heavy hand which is much appreciated!!!
author: Dustin L.

description: When I feel like adding some sleaze into my life I'll swing in to the ol' Sutter Station for some happy hour lingerie cocktails.  Maybe that's what scares me off about this place.  It seems like a truck stop off a Southern highway or something.
author: Chard M.

description: This is probably one of the dirtiest bars in the area. I can't say that it's really a  problem for me, but if you even think about eating one of those floating hot dogs, I'm signing you up for Fear Factor, dude. The people here are all friendly, but in a weird way. Like, that dude who works here, but you can't quite figure out what he does. He'll come up to you and say something that makes you think that he's continuing a conversation that you don't even remember starting. Then he'll just walk away as effortlessly as he came over. Beers are cheap, but not "oh my God" cheap. Yeah, and I'm pretty sure that you can get shanghaied in the back room/downstairs area. The place that I see women coming out of and going into with suitcases and bundles of money. I don't know what's going on down there, and I'm not looking to find out.
author: Mike M.

description: Always a solid choice.  For the financial district, this is about as divey as it get's.  Don't get me wrong the chick who wear the huss bag ensemble on Friday selling raffle tickets is always a nice additional.  The bartenders whom are all girls I might add don't put up w/ any shit and are the 1st ones to drop the sledgehammer.  Very reasonable drinks and usually on Friday there is some type of food buffet.  I swore to people it was chicken as it had always been chicken when I was there.  Ahhhh wrong.  I was schooled so hard this past Friday when it was pizza.  My bad...  But go, good times none the less.
author: Nicole F.

description: I could say I would have never been to Sutter Station if it wasn't  next to the bus stop. after having some drinks with a friend and waiting to long for our ride(the bus) . we went in for another. It is so much bigger then it looks. the music is good. the vibe is good. Very diverse crowd. The bartenders where fast and friendly.I loved the dim lighting. And those drinks made my bus ride alot more fun, and i didn't have to stumble far. thanks for taking care of me door man!
author: Joy I.

description: Sometimes good sometimes bad.  I like it but if you are easily offended or don't like dive bars then don't come here for sure.
author: Justin J.

description: Easily the best, no-nonsense bar in downtown SF, if not all SF. Reasonable prices, great hours, convenient location, nice selection and a palatable atmosphere. Sutter Station has a great mix of regular drunks, pool hustlers, suited finance types and people generally looking to enjoy themselves in a bar. If you're looking for a club, this isn't it. If you're looking for a place to get several cheap drinks before/after catching BART, there is no better place.
author: Burnas M.

description: I went here yesterday (a wednesday) for happy hour.  There arent actually any happy hour specials that i could find.... our drinks ended up ranging from $6-9, which doesnt seem happy hourish.  But, my amaretto sour was very good and strong, not too soury, very amarettoy.  A lot of places make that wrong.  This is a little dive bar, very small, and crowded.  We had to wait a tiny bit to get a table, but not too long.  At the back room, there is a pool table.  At first, the crowd was more people right out of work, but then it went over to the regulars.  Which happened maybe 630 or 615.  It's funny, that place is so cramped and then when you walk in you get ambushed for your id, while people are squeezing by with their drinks.  The best part about this bar tho is the lingere.  Ok, i cant spell, but i mean underwear.  I guess on tues and thurs they have a lingere show, but on the other days, they have a woman who walks around in her lingere, changing often, selling raffle tickets to guys, and giving a free one to every woman.  You can win a free drink, or lingere.  we didnt win.  the other girls were a bit offed by the presence of this woman but i thought it was great.  really quirky and just fun.  it seems like it's a great job too, cuz she'd get a lot of tips.  kudos to you lingere girl at sutter.  :)  i just wish theyd had the full show there when i was there.
author: Merredith L.

description: i cant believe someone gave the "station" 1 star... and just because its sleazy!  thats like saying i hate korean bbq because you walk outta there smelling like a garlic grease pit....the "station" is sleazy for sure, but its sleazy in a disgustingly great way!  i work right above the sutter station tavern... and after a hard days work, i like to come on down and hang with the crew.  the lingerie show is only on t/th (5-7) now :( they got pool tables and nice wide bar stools for when your ass is feeling a little fat.  but the best thing is that they open at 10am!  ill often make a quick detour on my way into work and hang with the regulars.  makes my day go by faster.  i dont know what id do without the "station".  its definitely become an extension of our office.
author: Curtis Y.

description: You know, it's true what was written already about the fact that you walk by this place and wonder "who really goes in there?". It looks like a complete dive, but, I'd have to say it's the nicest dive I've been into in a long time. What most people call a dive bar, well, they just haven't lived here very long. There really aren't many dive bars left in this city after the dot com boom. They've all been discovered and ruined! But Sutter Station lives on as a funky, cool, sf dive bar. The inside is quite nice, actually. WIsh I had my camera to take a pic. It's all wood panneling inside and lit up with white xmas lights. It's super busy with after work folks mixing with all day drinkers. You know it's a dive bar when....(drum roll please)....each round you get of the same drink is totally different!! haha...seriously. I kept it simple with a rasberry stoli and soda, and asked for a splash of lime (ok, not super simple, but not hard either). First round I got a cranberry splash, and the soda was flat, second round I got a splash of lemon twist, third round I got a lime finally, but never any lime juice. So funny. I'd still go back again, the drinks were strong and the after work vibe was fun.
author: michelle B.

description: i come here almost every weekend.. amazing bartenders.. STRONG and CHEAP drinks.. the owner kind of looks mean but shes actually pretty nice.. one bartender last week was sooo sweet, we tipped her after ever drink and she came up to our table to return our tip.  such a sweetheart! everyone is super friendly, diverse customers... never once saw or got into any problems here.. its a little hole in the wall, 2 pool tables in the back, jukebox, flat scrren that constantly plays sports channels.. love love love this place.
author: Sarah R.

description: my bulleit bourbon (neat, thank you) was poured as a double.  i paid for a single.  this was the first sign of a cool and friendly local spot.  i was only there for a second, stopping for a drink after class with some friends but i'm a big fan of reasonable prices and even more reasonable pours.  times are hard, getting your drink on shouldn't be.
author: Jason S.

description: I'm not exavtly sure what to say about the sutter station..especially after reading some of the reviews. Where I used to work we dubbed it "the gutter".   I had been going to this bar in the afternoons for years as I worked down the street.  Really...the beer is stale and the prices are high and they don't take credit or debit cards.  If I just think of this place and Barbara the owner, and some of the times I've had there...It just makes me laugh out loud!  It's pretty funny to go there for "the fashion show", once a week a young lady wears her underwear in the afternoon and sells raffle tickets to the patrons and then she pulls a ticket and the winner gets her underwear!  This isn't a strip club and she doesn't get naked..it's pretty funny.  It all happens because Barbara the owner is such a charecter.  Other than that it's dark, two pool tables and 50 cent on replay with a totally diverse crowd.  Where "the real people "hang!
author: Daniel Q.

description: Sutter Station reminds me of those scary bars in Penn Station where all of the alcoholic commuters stay until the very last train rolls so they can avoid their wives on Long Island.  It's a funny place though because of the strange crowd.  I'm giving it an extra star because I won the raffle from the bodacious lingerie girl.  Now I have a HYPNOTIQ t-shirt.
author: Larry T.

description:
the best and only bar in the fidi to get a stiff cocktail AND  to win panties!!!!im there every wednesday from 5:30-7:30pm.come visit me or any of the hotties behind the bar.just  mention you saw this review  for a few free lingerie tix from me! :~)
xo
author: Ms.Yelper W.

description: there's good seedy-- and then there's 'breaking health codes' seedy. this happens to be the latter. i think the saddest thing about this place is the people who think they're cool by frequenting here. haha. i mean c'mon, i have nothing against dives, but there is nothing is more lame than sutter gutter.... from the sticky bar stools to the putrid stench in the restroom and the obnoxious guys screaming and slamming dice cups on the bar it couldnt be more annoying. to make matters worse, they have the absolute worst bartenders in SF. then, to put the icing on the cake, they have a sleazy lingerie show at happy hour and its defintely NOT victorias secret. its more like they grabbed a few of those girls off of 6th street to walk around in underwear and pass out raffle tickets. i was forced to meet someone here after work a few times and i felt like i needed a long shower right after we left the place. there's so many decent dives in this city that if you have any taste at all you wont be caught dead here.
author: Michelle I.

description: This bar has a little bit of everything, just like a good drink. i work here so i give it 5 stars for outstanding service. its definitely a dive bar, and has been under the same ownership for 50 years, but i can attest to the bar's cleanliness. i've worked at many bars/ restaurants in the city and some of  your fancy-russian hill bars are the most disgusting roach infested establishments in the city. the "gutter" is very clean in that regard and has one of the cleanest bathrooms i've ever seen in a bar. the lingerie shows are more comedic than sexy, but that's kind of the idea (save for the 3-4 older men who patronize the bar only for the "shows" and most likely haven't seen a woman in lingerie since the carter administration. it is a bit of a sausage fest, but to that end i can say most ladies that do roll in solo have at least one drink bought for them by a kindly man. its a sociological experience.  p.s. working to improve jukebox.... stay tuned and drop by.
author: Whitney F.

description: awesome HH crowd.  right on Market,  so very convenient and great friendly crowd.  see you there !
author: tom s.
